activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamal Clauzelle Shaw

records.addlTxt:
10:33 AM Defendant Jamal Clauzelle Shaw in court.  Attorney Shanna Sanders in court for Jamal Clauzelle Shaw.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Calendar call on September 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:38 AM Defendant Jamal Clauzelle Shaw in court by video with attorney Shanna Sanders by video.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Trulley sworn in and testified. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects without argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on May 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:56 PM Defendant Jamal Clauzelle Shaw in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Shanna Sanders by video. Alexander David Goulart appeared in person with intern Margaret Ginocchio by video for the State of Wisconsin. Address and date of birth verified. Court orders $2000 Signature Bond with conditions: No possession of weapons. Curfew from 6pm to 6am unless at work or traverling to and from work.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom. Preliminary hearing scheduled May 9, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

May not possess any weapons. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. To be in residence from 6pm to 6am unless at work or traveling to or from work.
